Description: The Master of Arts in Education (MAE) program is designed to empower you as an educator and advance your career. Whether you are looking to become a principal, specialize in a subject area or simply become a better teacher, our program offers the flexibility and curriculum to help you meet your goals. Findlay’s MAE program is offered fully online.
Accredidation: The College of Education at the University of Findlay is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

EnglishScore: Official scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) or Duolingo English Test (DET) are required if your native language is not English.

Description: The Master of Arts in Professional Communication (MAPC) works to develop your writing, speaking, and leadership skills. This degree is designed to help you advance in your current career or prepare for a new one. The program is available 100% online, on-campus, or a combination of both. Courses cover topics such as technical writing, persuasion, leadership, research, and more.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Rhetoric and Writing
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) or the Duolingo English test and submit their scores directly to The University of Findlay.

Department: College of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Rhetoric and Writing (MARW) provides a broad understanding of the discipline of rhetoric and writing. The program helps students develop their own writing skills while also learning how to teach writing and how to apply rhetorical theories in professional settings. This degree is ideal for high school teachers seeking qualification to teach dual-enrollment courses (such as College Credit Plus), instructors at community colleges, or individuals preparing for doctoral work or careers in professional writing. The MARW program is 100% online and features live virtual classes.
ScholarshipAmount: Full-tuition waiver and a $7,500 stipend for graduate assistantships.

Description: The University of Findlay's Master of Arts in TESOL (Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages) and Applied Linguistics will help you become an expert language teacher and leader. English is the most commonly taught language in the world, and there is a high demand for qualified TESOL professionals. Our program is designed to meet the needs of those with or without prior teaching experience.

Official transcripts from all institutions attended sent directly to the University of Findlay's Office of Admissions. A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher is required.* One letter of recommendation. Current resume. A personal statement outlining your professional goals and how the University of Findlay’s MBA can help you achieve them. *Applicants with a GPA between 2.5 and 2.99 can be conditionally admitted.
Description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) is designed to equip the student with skills that can be directly applied in the workplace. The program offers an extensive range of concentrations, allowing students to tailor their education to their career goals. Whether you are looking to advance your current career or start a new one, the University of Findlay's MBA program can help you achieve your goals.
Accredidation: The University of Findlay's College of Business is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, Alumni Discounts, Endowed Scholarships

Description: The University of Findlay's Master of Occupational Therapy (MOT) Program is a professional entry-level degree program that prepares students to become registered occupational therapists (OTR). Occupational therapists help people of all ages to do the things they want and need to do through the therapeutic use of daily activities (occupations). Common occupational therapy interventions include helping children with disabilities to participate fully in school and social situations, helping people recovering from injury to regain skills, and providing supports for older adults experiencing physical and cognitive changes.
Accredidation: The entry-level occupational therapy master’s degree program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Occupational Therapy Education (ACOTE) of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA).

Accredidation: The Accreditation Review Commission on Education for the Physician Assistant, Inc. (ARC-PA) has granted Accreditation-Continued status to the University of Findlay Physician Assistant Program sponsored by the University of Findlay.

The program offers a unique blend of technical and managerial coursework, ensuring that graduates are not only proficient in the latest technologies but also capable of leading teams and making strategic decisions.

Health informatics is the practice of acquiring, studying and managing health data and applying medical concepts in conjunction with health information technology systems to help clinicians provide better healthcare.

Description: The Master of Science in Radiologic Sciences (MSRS) program is designed for radiologic technologists who desire to advance their careers. The program is offered 100 percent online and can be completed in as little as 24 months. The MSRS program builds on your previous education and experience to provide you with the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in leadership roles in the radiologic sciences profession.

Description: University of Findlay’s Doctor of Education in School Psychology creates a path for students to become licensed school psychologists. This program is designed for students who have obtained a bachelor's degree and wish to pursue a career in school psychology. The program prepares graduates to work in schools, clinics, and other educational settings to support the academic, social, and emotional needs of children and adolescents.
Accredidation: The College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The School Psychology program is approved by the National Association of School Psychologists (NASP) and the Ohio Department of Higher Education (ODHE).

Requirements: The University of Findlay's OTD program is a participant in the Centralized Application Service for Occupational Therapy (OTCAS) for all applicants (including current UF students). A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Completion of all prerequisite courses with a grade of C or better. Prerequisite coursework must be completed within seven years prior to application. 20 hours of observation with an occupational therapist or occupational therapy assistant in a minimum of two different practice settings. The observation form is provided here. Three letters of recommendation submitted through OTCAS. On-campus interview by invitation only. Students for whom English is their second language must submit a TOEFL score of 89 with a 26 in speaking or higher.
Description: Prepare for your future as an occupational therapist with the University of Findlay’s Doctor of Occupational Therapy Program. Occupational therapists help people of all ages do the things they want and need to do through the therapeutic use of daily activities (occupations). Common occupational therapy interventions include helping children with disabilities to participate fully in school and social situations, helping people recovering from injury to regain skills, and providing supports for older adults experiencing physical and cognitive changes. The University of Findlay’s Doctor of Occupational Therapy Program is a three-year, post-baccalaureate program designed to prepare students to become entry-level occupational therapists. This program includes six semesters of didactic and clinical coursework, followed by two semesters of Level II Fieldwork and one semester of the Doctoral Capstone Experience.
Accredidation: The entry-level occupational therapy doctoral degree program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Occupational Therapy Education (ACOTE) of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA).

IELTS requirement: A minimum overall band score of 6.5 is required. Students that do not meet the minimum TOEFL or IELTS score may be considered for conditional admission. Students who have successfully completed the University of Findlay's Intensive English Language Program are not required to take the TOEFL or IELTS.

Two letters of recommendation are required (one must be from a physical therapist). Description: Findlay's Physical Therapy Program provides an environment that allows our students to become competent, caring, and ethical providers of physical therapy services. We offer two programs to help you reach your goals: Traditional Program - The traditional program is three years in length and consists of six semesters of course work and 34 weeks of full-time clinical experience. Weekend PTA to DPT Bridge Program - The bridge program is three years in length and consists of small group, problem-based learning and online coursework as well as three on-campus weekend institutes per semester.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Physical Therapy Program at the University of Findlay is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation in Physical Therapy Education (CAPTE)
ScholarshipType: Diversity in Physical Therapy Scholarship, Dr. Jane F. Miller Endowed Scholarship, The Ken and Ginnie L. Cole Endowed Scholarship, UF PT Student Scholarship

Description: The University of Findlay's College of Pharmacy prepares you to be a knowledgeable, confident and capable professional. You will gain the experience and knowledge to act as a servant leader and advocate for patient health. Findlay is one of the few pharmacy programs in the nation to offer a 0-6 program. This means you are admitted directly into the professional program as a senior in high school. No PCAT is required. During your final four years, you will complete nine, one-month rotations of experiential learning in community, high-acuity, hospital and rural settings.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Pharmacy program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE).

Description: The Data Analytics Certificate program consists of four classes designed to give students the knowledge and skills to manage and analyze data for business and scientific purposes. The program focuses on various aspects of data analytics such as data preparation, data visualization, statistical analysis, and machine learning. Students will learn how to clean and organize data, create visualizations to communicate findings, and apply statistical and machine learning techniques to make predictions and decisions based on data. The program also covers ethical considerations and best practices for data management. Upon completion of the program, students will be able to demonstrate proficiency in data analytics tools and techniques and apply them to real-world problems. They will be prepared for careers in data analysis, business intelligence, and related fields.

The Higher Learning Commission (HLC) requires high school teachers to hold a master’s degree in the field or a master’s degree plus 18 graduate hours in the field to teach dual enrollment courses. The University of Findlay offers dual enrollment certificates in English and mathematics. Courses are offered online and in 8-week blocks.

The program prepares students to be competent entry-level sonographers in the cognitive (knowledge), psychomotor (skills), and affective (behavior) learning domains.

Description: Diagnostic medical sonography is a medical imaging modality that uses high frequency sound waves to create images of the human body. Sonographers are highly skilled professionals who use critical thinking and specialized equipment to obtain diagnostic images to aid the physician in the diagnosis of disease or pathology. The diagnostic medical sonography program offers three areas of emphasis: general imaging (abdomen and obstetrics/gynecology), echocardiography (adult echocardiography), and vascular sonography.
Accredidation: The Diagnostic Medical Sonography Program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP) upon the recommendation of the Joint Review Committee on Education in Diagnostic Medical Sonography (JRC-DMS).

Description: Logistics and supply chain management is all about the movement of physical goods and information. It deals with ordering, shipping, tracking, and managing the supplies needed to make products and delivering finished products to customers. In a global economy, supply chain management is often the key to the success of an organization. This is especially true for companies that purchase their raw materials or parts from overseas or sell their products to customers all over the world.

Description: The Sustainability Minor provides students with the opportunity to study the concepts and practices of sustainability from a variety of disciplines. Sustainability is a concept that is becoming increasingly important in our society. It involves meeting the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.

EnglishScore: The University of Findlay requires all applicants whose native language is not English to demonstrate their English proficiency. This can be done by achieving a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (70 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (50), or Duolingo English Test (100). Description: Findlay's TESOL Program prepares you to teach English to non-native speakers in the U.S. or anywhere in the world. You will learn how to: Design and implement lesson plans, Assess student learning, Manage a classroom, Understand the role of culture in language learning. Our program combines classroom instruction with hands-on experience, so you'll graduate ready to lead your own classroom.

The program emphasizes the development of advanced skills in strategic planning, message creation, and audience analysis. Students will learn to create, manage, and deliver complex information across various media platforms to diverse audiences. The program prepares graduates for leadership roles in public relations, technical writing, corporate communication, and non-profit management.
